_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Environmental Protection Agency - Risk Management Plan

North Little Rock Terminal

RMP Executive Summary

2019 Resubmittal



DESCRIPTION OF STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES



The North Little Rock Terminal is a refined products terminal owned by Magellan Terminal Holdings, L.P.  The facility is located in Little Rock, AR and stores and distributes petroleum products such as gasoline and diesel while encompassing 41 acres with above ground storage tanks and pressure vessels.  In addition to petroleum storage, Magellan stores butane onsite for blending into gasoline which requires compliance with the PSM and RMP regulations as greater than 10,000 lbs are stored onsite.  



The regulated substance at this facility is butane and a smaller quantity of propane.  The equipment which handles butane includes six pressure vessels and associated piping.  The pressure vessel and associated piping may contain over 2,070,000 lbs of butane while the single storage tank of propane stores 77,000 lbs without taking into account any controls.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES



The North Little Rock Terminal has a strong commitment to worker and public safety, along with resources invested in accident prevention, such as training personnel and contractors in design, installation, operations, and maintenance procedures.  If an emergency were to occur, it is the company's policy to notify the North Little Rock LEPC and request that they respond to the emergency.



GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND MAINTENANCE PROGRAM



The regulated butane/propane storage and blending process in the facility is compliant with the fourteen (14) elements of Process Safety Management and other employee training programs, along with operating and maintenance procedures.  The process controls listed in Section 7.4e were chosen based on whether or not they were used as safeguards in the most current PHA for this facility or if they were recommended from

the latest PHA and installed prior to the RMP submittal.  There may be other process controls in this facility that were not identified as safeguards in the most current PHA.  The facility has no "Trade Secrets".  The facility complies with the Federal and State requirements for leak detection of valves, pumps, and flanges.  Inspections are conducted and documented to ensure the integrity of the regulated equipment.



FIVE-YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



There has been no accidental release from the butane process at the North Little Rock terminal that has required reporting under the RMP rule within the past five year.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



The facility is considered a non-responding facility.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



No changes are currently planned to the butane process.  As opportunities for improvement associated with the new butane process arise at the North Little Rock Terminal, they will be evaluated by Magellan Terminal Holdings, L.P.
